title: Xeriscaping & Drought-Resistant Design
intro: Beautiful, low-maintenance landscapes that save water. Trade your thirsty lawn for a vibrant, texture-rich design.
highlights: Lawn removal and replacement with river rock, mulch, or decomposed granite
Succulent and cactus gardens that thrive in heat
Cold-hardy plant selections to survive winter freezes
Weed-barrier fabric installation for lower maintenance

avgCost.notes: Cost depends heavily on total square footage of turf removal and density of new plantings.

faqs.q: Is xeriscaping just for modern houses?
faqs.a: No, pros can design xeriscapes in various stylesâ€”from modern minimal with steel edging to cottage-style with abundant flowering sages.

faqs.q: Will my yard get hotter without grass?
faqs.a: Hardscapes can retain heat, which is why designers balance rock with mulch and canopy trees to shade the ground and keep ambient temperatures down.
